interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Everyone's Hero
Review Date: 2013/11/11
Store: Jake T. Austin  (Actor),     Brian Dennehy  (Actor),     Christopher Reeve  (Director),     Colin Brady  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Kids & Family, Family Features
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Ten-year-old baseball fanatic Yankee Irving (voiced by newcomer Jake T. Austin) is always the last one picked for sandlot baseball games. But when Babe Ruth's prized bat is stolen during the 1932 World Series, Yankee steps up to the plate to help retrieve it for his beloved idol. He embarks on a wild cross-country journey that teaches him the stuff real heroes are made of, and along the way, Yankee learns the importance of perseverance and the true meaning of friendship.", 'Amazon.com', 'A talking baseball and a talking bat might not be the most likely characters to inspire a personal revelation about perseverance and self-esteem, but in', "Everyone's Hero", 'it\'s just those two things that help young Yankee Irving (Jake T. Austin) overcome his reputation as a baseball loser and become a true American hero. A ten-year old spurned by the neighborhood kids because of his repeated strike-outs at bat, Yankee is at a point of personal crisis. A chance encounter with a talking foul ball named Screwie (Rob Reiner) and some time spent with his father (Mandy Patinkin), who\'s a janitor for the New York Yankees, gives Yankee cause for some serious reflection. When Babe Ruth\'s famous bat "Darlin\'" (Whoopi Goldberg) is stolen by opposing teammate Lefty Maginnis (William H. Macy) and Yankee\'s father is fired as a result of the theft, it suddenly falls to Yankee and his new friend Screwie to find Darlin\' and return her to Babe Ruth before the Chicago Cubs loose the final game of the World Series to the New York Yankees. The combined efforts of Screwie, Darlin\', and new friend Marti Brewster (Raven-Symoné) aid Yankee in conquering his own self-doubt and infuse him with the self-confidence and strength to profoundly affect both his family and the entire baseball world. Produced by Christopher Reeve, this CGI animated presentation features a great cast of characters and voice talent, and an important message about the power of perseverance. (Ages 5 and older) --', 'Tami Horiuchi', 'Beyond', "Everyone's Hero", "Everyone's Hero: The Movie Storybook (Paperback)", 'More Sports-Themed Family Films', 'Nothing is Impossible: Reflections on a New Life', 'by Christopher Reeve', 'Stills from', "Everyone's Hero"]
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': "Children's", 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Animated, Dolby, Dubbed, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Colin Brady, Robert Kurtz, Ralph Coppola, Brian Dennehy, Whoopi Goldberg, Raven-Symon, Ritchie Allen, Jason Harris, Ed Helms, Howard Jonas, Robert Wagner, Cherise Boothe, Jesse Bronstein, Jeff Hand, Christopher Reeve, Rob Reiner, Jake T. Austin, Dan St. Pierre  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 28 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1, 1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.3 x 7.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '886377', 'Director': 'Christopher Reeve, Colin Brady, Dan St. Pierre', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Animated, Dolby, Dubbed, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 28 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 20, 2007', 'Actors': 'Jake T. Austin, Brian Dennehy, Whoopi Goldberg, Ritchie Allen, Rob Reiner', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Writers': 'Howard Jonas, Jeff Hand, Robert Kurtz', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I'm not sure why this got such bad cinematic reviews. My daughter thinks it's hysterical and she loves watching it with her grandpa, who is an umpire!
Review Title: Cute little baseball movie
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ["Darragh O'Connell", 'Timothy Björklund'], 'Producers': ['Kate Boutilier', 'Eryk Casemiro', 'Patricia Resnick', 'Cathal Gaffney', 'Gillian Higgins', 'Karen Ialacci', 'Megan Laughton', 'Diana Manson'], 'Starring': ['Olivia']}
Really wish this show was still on the air! It's clever in a way that makes me laugh almost as much as my daughter. Adorable!
Olivia is adorable
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brian Percival', 'David Evans', 'Philip John', 'Andy Goddard', 'Catherine Morshead', 'Minkie Spiro', 'Brian Kelly', 'Michael Engler', 'Ben Bolt', 'Ashley Pearce'], 'Starring': ['Huge Bonneville', 'Michelle Dockery', 'Maggie Smith'], 'Studio': ['BritBox']}
I didn't really understand the hoopla surrounding this show. From the outside it just looked like a show about a bunch of stuffy nobles, but one episode and I was hooked! Great show!
Now I get it...
The Little Mermaid (Two-Disc Diamond Edition: Blu-ray / DVD + Digital Copy)
Jodi Benson  (Actor),     Christopher Daniel Barnes  (Actor),     Ron Clements  (Director, Writer),     John Musker  (Director, Writer)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    G    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Kids & Family
['THE LITTLE MERMAID, one of the most celebrated animated films of all time, is now spectacularly transformed for the first time on Blu-ray, with a state-of-the-art digitally restored picture and brilliant high-definition sound! Venture under the sea where Ariel, a free-spirited mermaid princess, longs to be part of the human world. After bravely striking a bargain with Ursula, a sneaky sea witch, Ariel embarks on the adventure of a lifetime. With Flounder and Sebastian at her side, Ariel will need all of her courage and determination to make things right in both her worlds.']

Bought a few of these for Christmas gifts and one for my own daughter. Looks great and still as fun as it was when I was a kid! Some of the best Disney songs ever in this film.
Who doesn't love The Little Mermaid?

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preferences:** This user has a continued affinity for clever and humorous programming that appeals to all ages, particularly family-friendly content that engages everyone. Their nostalgia for classic animated films remains prominent, reinforcing a love for timeless storytelling.

- **Viewership Patterns:** They consistently prefer animated and family-oriented shows, while also exploring sophisticated and period-themed content. Their recent interest leans towards sports-themed family films, showcasing versatility in their entertainment choices.

- **Emotional Engagement:** The user maintains a deep emotional connection to narratives that resonate with familial experiences. Their latest interaction highlights appreciation for films that promote themes of perseverance and friendship, evoking sentimental memories shared during family viewing.

- **Sentiment Analysis:** The user exhibits a consistently positive sentiment towards a diverse range of content, emphasizing quality storytelling suitable for all generations. Their recent review indicates a strong endorsement for lighthearted films that spark joy among families.

- **Younger Audience Appeal:** While they continue to favor content tailored for younger audiences, the user appreciates narratives with mature themes, indicating an evolving taste that captivates both children and adults alike.

Overall, this user embraces a delightful blend of charming family programming and sophisticated narratives, fostering familial connections, nostalgia, and laughter while remaining open to new viewing adventures.
